title: Mark Norell obituary: palaeontologist who showed that dinosaurs still walk among us — as birds
summary:
Nature, Published online: 09 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03322-y

Through fieldwork and innovative research, he transformed how scientists and the public perceive the prehistoric world.
body: Nature, Published online: 09 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03322-y Through fieldwork and innovative research, he transformed how scientists and the public perceive the prehistoric world.

title: Psychedelic beer may have helped pre-Inca empire in Peru schmooze elite outsiders and consolidate power
summary: The Wari used beer mixed with psychedelics to help build an empire in Peru around 1,200 years ago, a new study suggests.

title: 'Harry Potter' materials land three scientists Nobel Prize in chemistry
summary: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal–organic frameworks."

title: Tracing the ancestry of barley in time and space
summary:
Nature, Published online: 08 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03232-z

The genetic ancestry of domesticated barley has been mapped at high resolution, with each genome segment traced to its wild origins and the date estimated…
body: Nature, Published online: 08 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03232-z The genetic ancestry of domesticated barley has been mapped at high resolution, with each genome segment traced to its wild origins and the date estimated for when it entered the domesticated lineage. The findings reveal a mosaic of contributions from across western and central Asia, shaped by early cultivation and later gene flow.

title: Harvest supermoon photos: See the moon at its biggest and brightest in pictures from around the world
summary: This year's full 'Harvest moon' was also a supermoon. Check out some of the best images of this lunar event with our worldwide gallery.

title: Nobel Prize in physics goes to three scientists who discovered bizarre quantum effect on large scales
summary: The 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics has been awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis "for the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunnelling and energy quantisation in an electric circuit."

title: The whale-shaped island in Belize with a 'great blue blowhole' — Earth from space
summary: This 2020 astronaut photo shows the unusual cetacean-like shape of Belize's Lighthouse Reef. It's home to the famous Great Blue Hole, which doubles as the island's "blowhole" when viewed from space.

title: Prizes must recognize machine contributions to discovery
summary:
Nature, Published online: 07 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03217-y

The future of science will be written by humans and machines together. Awards should reflect that reality.
body: Nature, Published online: 07 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03217-y The future of science will be written by humans and machines together. Awards should reflect that reality.

title: Shackleton's infamous ship 'Endurance clearly had several structural deficiencies,' new analysis reveals
summary: Ernest Shackleton's ship, the Endurance, infamously sank in Antarctica — and now a new study finds that it had known flaws.

title: Sneaky asteroid zooms past Antarctica closer than a satellite — and astronomers didn't catch it until hours after
summary: A small, giraffe-size asteroid called 2025 TF came closer to Earth than some satellites on Wednesday (Oct. 1), stunning astronomers who first spotted it hours later.

title: Dramatic 'fireballs' expected during Draconid meteor shower this week: How to get the best views
summary: Expect a modest-but-convenient display of "shooting stars" after sunset, with a chance of bright "fireballs," as the Draconids peak this week.

title: 2,700-year-old temple with 'sacred cave' discovered in Turkey — and it may honor the 'mother goddess'
summary: The temple may have been dedicated to a mother goddess worshipped by many cultures, including the Greeks and the Romans.

title: العناني أول مصري وعربي يتولى رئاسة اليونسكو.. والسيسي يهنئه
summary: ‏‎انتخب المجلس التنفيذي لمنظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) بأغلبية ساحقة خالد العناني مرشح مصر لمنصب مدير عام المنظمة، وذلك خلال الانتخابات التي جرت الإثنين، حسبما أفاد المتحدث باسم الخارجية المصرية.

title: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS may come from the mysterious frontier of the early Milky Way, new study hints
summary: The interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS does not come from our corner of the Milky Way, and may be a time capsule of the early galaxy, new research into its trajectory hints.

title: من المرشح المصري الأوفر حظا لقيادة اليونسكو؟
summary: يجرى الإثنين تصويت حاسم للمجلس التنفيذي لليونسكو، منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة، بهدف اختيار المدير العام المقبل، في خطوة تكتسب أهمية فائقة، إذ سيتولى الفائز قيادة المنظمة لـ4 سنوات وسط اتهامها بأنها "مسيسة"، وفي ظل الارتباك الذي أحدثه إعلان الولايات المتحدة خروجها منها.

title: Corleck Head: A spooky three-faced Celtic sculpture found on the 'Hill of Death' in Ireland — and it may have been connected to human sacrifice 1,900 years ago
summary: The meaning of the three-faced Corleck Head has puzzled experts for centuries.

title: Connecting the dots: I trace the history of the East Kolkata Wetlands
summary:
Nature, Published online: 06 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03231-0

Environmental-humanities researcher Jenia Mukherjee uncovers the complex relationship between people, canals and wetlands in Kolkata, India.
body: Nature, Published online: 06 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03231-0 Environmental-humanities researcher Jenia Mukherjee uncovers the complex relationship between people, canals and wetlands in Kolkata, India.

title: Science history: Edwin Hubble uncovers the vastness of the universe with discovery of 'standard candle' — Oct. 5, 1923
summary: On the night of Oct. 5, 1923, Edwin Hubble observed a strange star that flickered in intensity at regular intervals. The star, dubbed M31-V1, was key to showing that the universe extended far beyond the borders of the Milky Way.

title: The James Webb telescope proves Einstein right, 8 times over — Space photo of the week
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope's latest image shows eight spectacular examples of gravitational lensing, a phenomenon that Albert Einstein first predicted some 100 years ago.

title: إغلاق قناة "ناصر".. وأسرة عبد الناصر تتحرك لإنقاذ الأرشيف
summary: أقدمت منصة "يوتيوب" على إغلاق قناة "Nasser TV (ناصر تي في)" التي كانت تبث تسجيلات نادرة للرئيس المصري الراحل جمال عبد الناصر، في خطوة أثارت تفاعلًا واسعًا خلال الساعات الماضية، وسط سعي أسرته لاستعادتها أو البحث عن بدائل لنشر باقي تسجيلاته النادرة.

Andrew Robinson reviews five of the best science picks.
body: Nature, Published online: 03 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03226-x Andrew Robinson reviews five of the best science picks.

body: Nature, Published online: 03 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03118-0 Being named as a Nobel laureate is the ultimate prize for many scientists, but how do other science prizes compare?

title: These alien planets are astronomers’ favourites: here’s why
summary:
Nature, Published online: 02 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03220-3

Space scientists look back on 30 years of exoplanet discoveries — from rows of massive ‘super-Earths‘ to worlds with perfectly synchronized orbits.
body: Nature, Published online: 02 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03220-3 Space scientists look back on 30 years of exoplanet discoveries — from rows of massive ‘super-Earths‘ to worlds with perfectly synchronized orbits.

title: Jane Goodall’s legacy: three ways she changed science
summary:
Nature, Published online: 02 October 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-03209-y

The primatologist challenged what it meant to be a scientist.

title: أوروبا تبحث تحديث قواعد ملفات الارتباط لتسهيل التصفح
summary: تسعى المفوضية الأوروبية إلى جعل تصفح الإنترنت أكثر سهولة، عبر تخفيف قواعد الخصوصية، وإيجاد طريقة جديدة لإدارة ملفات الارتباط (الكوكيز).

title: جوائز "نوبل" الساخرة تكرّم أصحاب أغرب البحوث والاختراعات
summary: حصلت اختراعات من بينها طلاء الأبقار بخطوط الحمير الوحشية لإبعاد الذباب عنها، وطهو الصلصة الإيطالية من دون تكوّن كِتل، على مكافآت نسخة ساخرة من جوائز "نوبل"، تحتفي بالبحث العلمي ولكن بطريقة مرحة.
